title: Finding Y Intercepts of Linear Functions

questionList.solution: The c component of the line is 3. Therefore, when x is equal to 0, 2 multiplied by x=0 is equal to 0, and 0+3 is equal to 3. Therefore, the y value at x=0 (which is the y-axis) is 3.
The c component of the line is 5. Therefore, when x is equal to 0, 3 multiplied by x=0 is equal to 0, and 0+5 is equal to 5. Therefore, the y value at x=0 (which is the y-axis) is 5.

questionList.qu: What is the y-intercept of `y = x+2`
questionList.solution: The c component of the line is 2. Therefore, when x is equal to 0, 1 multiplied by x=0 is equal to 0, and 0+2 is equal to 2. Therefore, the y value at x=0 (which is the y-axis) is 2.
The c component of the line is 1. Therefore, when x is equal to 0, 3 multiplied by x=0 is equal to 0, and 0+1 is equal to 1. Therefore, the y value at x=0 (which is the y-axis) is 1.
By moving the 1 to the other side of the equation, you get y-3x+2. Therefore, when x=0, y is equal to 2, so the y-intercept is 2.
By moving the -3 to the other side of the equation, you get y-3x+5. Therefore, when x=0, y is equal to 5, so the y-intercept is 5.
